result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Do not possess firearms or dangerous weapons.

The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  Defendant may not withdraw from any ordered program without permission of the agent and/or provider.  The Defendant is to complete an AODA assessment and a Domestic Abuse assessment and comply with any treatment recommended.    The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  The Defendant is to obtain and maintain full time employment.  Defendant is to have no contact with C.L.  The Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis, unless already provided.  Defendant is to comply with all terms of Deferred Judgment Agreement.

timeConds.notes: To be served in lock up. Stayed for violations of probation.

Case Status Memo - Atty DuQuaine
Court Order Regarding August 8, 2022, In Person Pretrial Conferences

The defendant shall appear on all court dates; give written notice to the Clerk of Court  within 48 hours of any change of address or telephone number;  shall not commit any crime; shall neither directly nor indirectly threaten, harass, intimidate or otherwise interfere with victims or witnesses in this action.  Call the Outagamie County Sheriff's Dept. at (920) 832-5633 within 48 hours for fingerprints and/or photos (to be completed within 21 days).  No use or possession of dangerous weapons. No contact with C.L.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety for pendency of case, except for prescribed medication. Defendant shall have no violent contact with C.S. as approved in 22FA121, no contact inside residence and at child's events, public to be present.
